title: How is Chinese history divided? - Quora

response.answer_text: Chinese history can be generally divided into two parts: A 5000 years of “ word-of-mouth” history which combines stories and legends, and a 5000 years of history that recorded by characters. The later 5000 years of history can also be divided into two parts: An official history written by government which is all about the empires and its bureaucratic system, and an in-formal history spread among civil society. The official history is very reliable, while the informal one are more inclusive.

By dynasties, mostly, and then it is followed by the period of the Republic of China and the period of the People’s Republic of China (current period). The only exception to this is the period between the Zhou dynasty and the Qin dynasty.
